abstract:
Linda Dillman, who oversees Wal-Mart’s health care system, answers questions about changes the company has made in the program.

.
snippet:
Linda Dillman, who oversees Wal-Mart’s health care system, answers questions about changes the company has made in the program.

.
lead_paragraph: Linda M. Dillman, who oversees the employee health care program at Wal-Mart, did not ask for the job. Indeed, when the chief executive of the company, the world’s largest retailer, told her of the appointment, she wondered, “Did I make somebody mad? Are they trying to tell me something?”

headline.main: The Public Face of Wal-Mart’s Health Care Program

byline.original: By Reed Abelson and Michael Barbaro

abstract: Salesforce.com wants to become a platform like Microsoft’s Windows operating system, a product so popular that it is the foundation for a veritable ecosystem of software developers.
snippet: Salesforce.com wants to become a platform like Microsoft’s Windows operating system, a product so popular that it is the foundation for a veritable ecosystem of software developers.
lead_paragraph: Marc Benioff has never been modest in his dreams for Salesforce.com, the business software company he founded in 1999.
